chapman.name: George Chapman

sample_source.label: [Michigan University] The Iliads of Homer prince of poets

chapman.notes: The samples are based on the first edition, accessible via the 'Sample Source' link. Note that widely available digital versions (e.g., Project Gutenberg) are often heavily modernized and differ significantly from this original text. For a recommended modern printed copy, consider the Princeton University Press edition ('Chapman's Homer: The Iliad').

reviews.text: The translation is a delight to read (or at least to browse through)...

pope.name: Alexander Pope

sample_source.label: [Michigan University] The Iliad: of Homer. Translated by Mr. Pope.

pope.notes: Pope's first edition, originally published in six volumes, is the recommended version of this work. Unlike many subsequent reprints and common digital versions (such as Project Gutenberg), the first edition preserves Pope's intended text and includes his extensive scholarly notes. The text used for the samples on this site is taken from a transcribed digital version provided by Michigan University (see 'Sample Source'). While this source offers recommended access to the first edition's text and notes, the most complete reading experience comes from a high-definition digital scan of the first edition. Versions available via platforms like HathiTrust are particularly recommended as they preserve the original 18th-century printing and typography.

reviews.text: It is certainly the noblest version of poetry which the world has ever seen; and its publication must therefore be considered as one of the great events in the annals of learning

cowper.name: William Cowper
cowper.description: Formal Miltonic blank verse aiming for strict fidelity to the Greek.

bryant.name: William Cullen Bryant
bryant.description: Fluent, accurate, and readable blank verse aiming for a natural narrative style.

caldcleugh.name: W. G. Caldcleugh
caldcleugh.description: Entertaining and energetic blank verse translation.

butler.name: Samuel Butler
butler.description: Well-known prose translation; accurate, unpretentious, and fluent.

reviews.text: Butler’s translation is among the best known and most popular prose translations of the Iliad—and deservedly so.

murray.name: A.T. Murray
murray.description: Scholarly, literal prose with facing Greek text (Loeb).

sample_source.label: [Perseus Digital Library] Homer. The Iliad with an English Translation

lattimore.name: Richmond Lattimore
lattimore.description: Literal verse; formal and syntactically dense.

graves.name: Robert Graves
graves.description: Unusual mix of prose and verse.

reviews.text: One of the finest English renditions of the Iliad available anywhere.

johnston.name: Ian Johnston
johnston.description: Modern, accessible public domain verse translation.
johnston.notes: Johnston's translation was first published online in 2002 and later in print by Richer Resources Publications in 2006.

kline.name: A.S. Kline
kline.description: Simple public domain prose; freely available.

reviews.text: Best characterized as an update on Lattimore’s.
